item.title: Pokemon Presents July 2025 - All the News and Announcements
item.content:encoded:
Today, The Pokemon Company held a Pokemon Presents showcase to highlight what's happening in the world of Pokemon in the coming months. Here's everything that was announced during the show!

Pokemon World Championships 2025 artwork revealed

We begin with a look at this year's Pokemon World Championships, which are happening in August. The Championship Sunday event will be held in an arena for the first time this year, and more than 20,000 attendees are expected to celebrate the event.

Pokemon Concierge's second season is coming in September

Next, we got a look at the new season of Pokemon Concierge, which begins airing on Netflix on September 4th. Cute Pokemon like Psyduck, the Pan trio of monkeys, and Shiinotic will be appearing in the hand-crafted stop-motion animated series.

Pokemon Tales: The Misadventures of Sirfetch'd & Pichu is coming in 2027

In December, we learned that Aardman and The Pokemon Company are collaborating on a brand new animation, and today, we learned what it's called. Pokemon Tales: The Misadventures of Sirfetch'd & Pichu will air in 2027, bearing Aardman's signature stop-motion style.

PokePark Kanto is opening in 2026

PokePark Kanto, the first "permanent outdoor Pokemon attraction", will be opening in 2026 in Japan's Yomiuriland amusement park. It looks like the perfect holiday destination if you want to immerse yourself in a world of real-life Pokemon (well, as close as you're going to get, anyhow).

Next, we got a series of announcements regarding ongoing Pokemon mobile games. Pokemon Go Fest Max Finale 2025 was first up, and it'll see Max Pokemon appearing, with Eternatus making its debut in the game as well.

Over in Pokemon Masters EX, you can look forward to battling Carmine and Sinistcha, and you can log in now to get a 3,000-gem gift. Pokemon Cafe Remix, meanwhile, is getting a very cute Lapras sea captain outfit, which is coming tomorrow.

In Pokemon Sleep, the legendary dog trio from Gen II will be added to the game, so you can look forward to researching Raikou, Entei, and Suicune in September. A new area is also coming to the game in November.

Pokemon Unite's fourth anniversary is bringing Latios and Latias into the fray, and Pawmi, Pawmo, and Pawmot are also set to make an appearance in the game soon.

Pokemon Friends is a cute mobile puzzler

If you've always wanted to solve cute little mobile puzzles with your Pokemon friends, then Pokemon Friends is for you. It's a puzzle game that sees you connecting various things, like tracks, bulbs, or ice paths, to help little critters reach their goals.

You'll gain plushes for solving puzzles, and you can use them to decorate in-game plush rooms. The game is coming to Switch, Android, and iOS later today.

Pokemon Scarlet and Violet are getting new Tera Raid Battle Events

Shiny versions of Pokemon Scarlet and Violet's Ruinous Quartet are coming starting from tomorrow. You can add them to your team, but each Pokemon will need to be defeated a million times (in total, not just by you) to get them.

Pokemon Champions gets more info

Next up, we got to learn more about Pokemon Champions, an upcoming battler that was revealed back in February. The game is planned for release in 2026 on Switch and mobile devices, and it looks like a fun way to enjoy Pokemon battling.

New Pokemon Legends: Z-A info revealed

The last thing we got to see as part of today's presentation was a new look at Pokemon Legends: Z-A, which is planned for release in October. Sorry, hopeful Pokemon fans; doesn't look like you're getting a Gen 10 reveal today.

The new trailer revealed Team MZ, an organization devoted to protecting Lumiose, where the game takes place. The game's day-night cycle was also revealed; you'll explore and catch Pokemon by day, then take part in the Z-A Royale tournament event by night.

This game's villainous team is the Rust Syndicate, headed up by the rather sinister-looking Corbeau. He's got "some kind of business with the members of Team MZ", but you'll have to play the game to find out what that is.

We got a look at a Mega Evolution for Dragonite as well, which is pretty cute. It's got Dragonair-like adornments on its head and tail, and it was shown off as part of a new storyline in the game that involves Pokemon Mega Evolving by themselves.

That's all for today! Join us again whenever the next Pokemon Presents airs, and we'll do it all again!

item.title: Single-Player Horror Game Hellraiser: Revival Announced by Saber Interactive
item.content:encoded:
Saber Interactive and Boss Team Games have announced Hellraiser: Revival, the first ever dedicated video game based on Clive Barker's immensely popular horror franchise.

As revealed in a new trailer, Hellraiser: Revival will take the form of a first-person, single-player survival horror game. You'll play as a new protagonist by the name of Aidan, who must rescue his girlfriend from Hell. Now that's a nostalgic plot setup, eh?

Saber's Tim Willits reveals more in a PlayStation Blog post accompanying the new trailer. In the post, Willits confirms that both melee and ranged weaponry will be available in Hellraiser: Revival, and that the development team consulted with Clive Barker himself to make sure the game is "authentic" to the original novels and movies.

Of course, Aidan will also have access to "the dark powers of the Genesis Configuration" to help him navigate Hell and save his girlfriend. You'll be harnessing the box's "infernal abilities" to avoid the wrath of the iconic Pinhead.

Said character will be played by original actor Doug Bradley, who Saber says is "returning to the role for the first time in nearly two decades". I don't think that's accurate, though; Bradley provided his voice for Dead by Daylight's Pinhead Killer back in 2022.

In any case, as revealed by Eurogamer, Barker himself seems enthusiastic about Hellraiser: Revival. He says the game captures the "essence" of the property, namely "the seductive pull of suffering" and "the beauty within the grotesque", so if you're a Hellraiser fan, it sounds like you'll be well-served by the game.

You can check out the debut trailer for Hellraiser: Revival, which shows off a little bit of gameplay as well as the aesthetic of the game, right here.

We don't yet have a release window for Hellraiser: Revival, but when it launches, it's coming to PC, PlayStation 5, and Xbox Series X|S. More info will be revealed later this year.

item.title: GreedFall II Studio Spiders Hit by Layoffs
item.content:encoded:
GreedFall II and Steelrising developer Spiders has apparently become the latest studio to be swept up in the ongoing wave of industry layoffs.

According to a LinkedIn post by lead animator Erwan Perrin (spotted by ResetEra user Maxime), Spiders will soon "proceed [with] a layoff plan" which will affect "most of the animation and rig team" at the studio. That's the team that creates character animations and frameworks.

It's not clear exactly how many employees will be hit by the layoffs, but it's not a great sign for Spiders if "most" of an entire team at the studio is being let go.

If you're not familiar with Spiders, it's a French studio responsible for developing games like the aforementioned GreedFall II and Steelrising, as well as The Technomancer, Bound by Flame, and other Eurojank-style RPG-adjacent titles.

In many ways, the studio is similar to Gothic and Elex developer Piranha Bytes, which should probably come as more cause for alarm; that studio, which was based in Germany, was shut down in 2024 by parent company THQ Nordic.

Given that GreedFall II is currently in Early Access, it's not entirely clear what these Spiders layoffs mean for the future of the game. According to SteamDB, however, GreedFall II has a 24-hour peak player count of just 13, so things aren't looking great for the studio.

These layoffs at Spiders are part of a wider industry pattern that has seen multiple studios lay off employees, cancel projects, or shut down entirely, and the phenomenon isn't just limited to smaller studios either.

Earlier this month, for instance, Microsoft laid off around 9,000 of its employees (yes, you read that number right), and as part of that employee cull, Rare's Everwild and The Initiative's Perfect Dark were canceled, with the latter closing its doors for good as well.

We'll have to wait and see what these layoffs might mean for Spiders, but I'm concerned about the studio's future. Stay tuned for more.
